moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Bc5: Giuoco Piano it will be: one of my favourites with White...
moves.4. O-O Nf6 5. c3: no fear for Nxe4: after Re1, White will set things straight...
moves.5... O-O 6. d4 exd4 7. cxd4 Be7: White has already castled, so Bb4 is of no use anymore...
moves.8. d5: White is already ahead in tempo...
moves.19... Bxb4 20. a3 Bc5+ 21. Kg2: Black is not getting any grip, on the White position...
moves.21... Nh7 22. Qb3: setting up a change of scenery...
moves.26... Kg8 27. Bg3 Bxe5: Black needs to release some tensions...
moves.28. fxe5 Re8 29. Qf5: although it might be too late for Black...
moves.29... Qc8: chess blindness, no doubt: Black should have tried Bxd5+; but the pin over Qd8 might prove lethal...
moves.30. Qxf7+: and Black resigned: probably fed up, with his own play..
